newsitem.title: GERMANY: GERMAN POLITICIANS TO DO SOCCER BROADCAST.
newsitem.headline: GERMAN POLITICIANS TO DO SOCCER BROADCAST.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel will take on political rival Edmund Stoiber, the minister-president of Bavaria, in a different arena -- from the commentary box at a Bundesliga soccer match.
Waigel and Stoiber said on Monday they had agreed to take part in Saturday's radio broadcast when Bayern Munich square off against cross-town rivals 1860 Munich.
Stoiber, a life-long Bayern Munich fan, says he will be living out a childhood dream.
Waigel, who supports 1860 Munich, known locally as The Lions, has postponed other business to meet the challenge.
Both are leaders of south Germany's Christian Social Union, one of Chancellor Helmut Kohl's coalition partners in Bonn.
Waigel suffered a painful defeat in 1993 when Stoiber outmanoeuvered him to become minister-president of Bavaria.
